events.name: Introductions and Formalities
events.description: The first meeting would be a good place to discuss the goals and structure of the group. We can do some setup for anyone knew to development or discuss any topics related to Android and Android development.

events.name: Android Studio Setup Roundtable
events.description: We will use this time to setup and start using the Android Studio to get apps and emulators up and running. Tips, tricks and plugins always appreciated to help with the development process.

events.name: Automated Testing and Design Overview
events.description: We'll have presentations covering Android automated testing and one covering design standards and best practices.

events.name: Android Design Standards Overview and Discussion
events.description: We will use this time to setup and start using the Android Studio to get apps and emulators up and running. Tips, tricks and plugins always appreciated to help with the development process.

events.name: Tablet Optimization
events.description: We will use this time to setup and start using the Android Studio to get apps and emulators up and running. Tips, tricks and plugins always appreciated to help with the development process.

events.name: Android Hack Session
events.description:
November will be a laid back month for specific questions and group share of knowledge of tools, tips, tricks and questions.

Enter through the double glass doors. If you'll be later than 7:15pm please let me know.

events.name: Cancelled
events.description: I'm canceling the December meeting given the holidays. Enjoy your break and we'll be meeting again in January.

events.name: Robolectric Unit Testing
events.description: I'll do a quick intro in to Unit Testing with Robolectric. If anyone else has a topic they'd like to cover, please let me know or we'll just answer any specific questions.

events.name: Reactive Java
events.description: An intro in to the reactive framework with RxJava.

events.name: Xamarin
events.description: Xamarin C# development for Android and iOS.

events.name: Xamarin
events.description: Enter through the big glass doors that say "DeveloperTown" on it from the south side of the building.

events.name: Android 101 - First App
events.description:
Bring your laptop and join us as we go through creating a project in Android Studio. We'll cover the basics of creating an app and how it uses activities and fragments to display data and interact with users.

Be sure to vote in the group poll about meeting day and time. We appreciate all feedback on finding the best time to meet to grow the group.

events.name: Google I/O Keynote
events.description: The 2014 Keynote will be on around lunch time here in Indy. Let's get together and see what's in store this year.

events.name: All About Fragments
events.description: Daniel Rees will be putting together a presentation explaining fragments in Android Development. From how they work to how their used. We'll be building on top of the RSS Reader we created in last month's meetup so be sure to follow along.

events.name: Android L Preview - SDK 20 API's and Material Design Introduction
events.description: We'll be demonstrating some of the new features of SDK 20 as well as discussing some of the high points and Google Guidelines for the Material Design. We'll try to implement some of the new design in to the existing meetup rss reader and use some of the new API changes.

events.name: Android Wear
events.description: Introduction to development for Android Wear.

events.name: AngularJS
events.description:
Overview: 

AngularJS is a JavaScript framework that helps developers build single page applications. During this presentation, Chad will focus on explaining what AngularJS is, and why it may be worth your consideration. There will be a brief code demonstration.  

Bio: 

Chad is a solutions architect, five-time, Microsoft MVP and founder of Ecofic He holds a BS degree from Purdue University where he focused his studies on computer science and psychology. Chad has been developing enterprise-level applications with a wide variety of technologies since 1999. He leveraged those experiences to author two internationally published books. In recent years, Chad has focused on building rich interactive applications with client-side technologies like AngularJS and machine learning.

events.name: Intro to Dart
events.description: Jacob Van Brunt will lead us on an intro to Dart.

events.name: Holiday Party
events.description: The group will be providing some snacks and food based on the number of RSVPs. Swing by, have a drink and say hello! We'll be getting back in to development after the first of the year.
events.how_to_find_us: We'll try to get a table so just ask the hostess!

events.name: Lightning Talks
events.description:
Get back in to the new year with some Lightning Talks. If you have a tool, pattern, library or anything that you'd like to share with the group or if you're just looking to see an array of new things join us!

If you'd like to present it would be great if you could email us so we can get a list going.

events.name: Android Fundamentals Study Jam - Week 1
events.description:
Hello, Googlers!

I know you have been waiting for signup details for the Android Study Jam. And so here they are! 

First, the Study Jam is absolutely FREE! Just visit this link to join the Study Jam group on Udacity. If you already have a Udacity account, use that. If not, sign up at that link. I have included some details and prerequisites about this course at the bottom of this invite.

Once you have joined the Study Jam group on Udacity, you can find the course at this link. You do not need to enroll in the course; you simply need to click the "Access course materials" button. To be clear: you will not need to pay Udacity since you will only be accessing the course materials.

In addition to registering at Udacity, please RSVP here so we can get an idea of how many will be joining us.

We will meet weekly on Wednesday evenings at DeveloperTown. Please have Lesson 1 completed before the February 11 event.

During the entire Study Jam you will be working towards a final project deliverable.

Each week we will:

• Have an overview of the lesson

• Have an open-ended discussion to answer any questions about the lesson

• Have time to work on your final project and get feedback on your progress

During the Study Jam, you will get:  

• Free in-person guidance & tutoring on the Udacity Android Fundamentals course

• Local community support of other students taking the course

• Opportunity for Android Fundamentals Udacity course certification; limited number of free certifications will be available to qualified students nationwide; discount on certification will be available to all students who complete the Study Jam.

I hope to see you all in February!

-Aaron Milam

Just a note: joining this Study Jam does not entitle you to a certification, however you can apply for a certification with Udacity once you have completed the course.

Google Developers Study Jams is a free series of global, community-run, in-person study groups. The first jam session is presented in partnership with Udacity and will follow their Android Fundamentals curriculum. This series will be led by certified Google Developer Group facilitators and will meet once weekly for 7 weeks.

Prerequisites: This is an Advanced course intended for students with at least 3 years of programming experience in Java or another object-oriented programming language (for example: C++, Objective C or Python). Udacity's Intro to Java is a helpful background if you're looking to refresh your Java skills.

events.name: Android Unit Testing
events.description: Unit tests are a great way to ensure code behavior and document intentions. Come by and learn how the setup and tools necessary to test your Android App.

events.name: Android Fundamentals Study Jam Week 2
events.description:
Welcome to week 2! Please finish Lesson 2 at Udacity before this session.

If you missed week 1, you are still welcome to come. Just finish Lessons 1 and 2 at Udacity before this meetup.

events.name: Android Fundamentals Study Jam Week 3
events.description:
Welcome to week 3! Please finish Lesson 3 at Udacity before this session.

If you missed week 1, you are still welcome to come. Just finish Lessons 1, 2, and 3 at Udacity before this meetup.

events.name: Android Fundamentals Study Jam Week 4
events.description: Welcome to week 4! Please finish Lesson 4 at Udacity before this session.

events.name: Android Fundamentals Study Jam Week 5
events.description: Welcome to week 5! Please finish Lesson 5 at Udacity before this session.

events.name: Android Fundamentals Study Jam Week 6
events.description: Welcome to week 6! Please finish Lesson 6 at Udacity before this session.

events.name: Android Study Jam - Final Projects
events.description:
This is for those that made it all the way through the Study Jam the past several weeks. Come and show off your final projects!

We will evaluate your code and offer help where you need it.﻿

events.name: RxJava
events.description:
Using Reactive Extensions for Android development.

Sample code on github - https://github.com/gdg-indy/rxjava

events.name: Geofencing: Stalking you should be happy about
events.description:
Cincy GDG Organizer and Android Guru Bill Mote will be giving a presentation surrounding Geofencing.

One of the coolest (and possibly creepiest) things about our phone is that it usually knows where we are in the world based on our coordinates in the GPS (Global Positioning System).  With that data we can make our apps do some pretty cool things!  Geofences define a GPS point and a radius in meters to create "triggers" for action.  I will show you how to setup the Google Maps API and add Geofences to any application.

About Bill Mote:

Bill was a lifelong infrastructure nerd with a passion for making things better, faster and more reliable.  The DevOps world just didn't give him enough heads down coding time so when Android hit the scene Bill decided to forgo his safety net and start developing for Android full time.  In addition to a handful of his own utility apps, Bill has built apps for startups and Fortune 50s alike with contributions to more than a dozen apps currently available in the Play Store.  Bill is the co-organizer of our Cincy Android Meetup as well as GDG Cincinnati and truly enjoys both the teachings and learnings he gets out of them.

events.name: Google I/O Keynote Viewing Party
events.description: Come watch the I/O Keynote with other Android developers at E-gineering. Lunch will be provided so please RSVP at the Google+ Event page: https://plus.google.com/events/crtqffnkuaugfa9ikt1fkknltho!﻿

events.name: Intro Dagger 2
events.description:
Join us during Igniting Indiana Entrepreneurship Week when Alex Wegener, Angie's List Android Developer, will show us how to write clean, testable Android code with Dagger 2.

We will be giving away a Moto 360 and two Chromecasts! Food and beverage will be provided.

events.name: Groovy & Gradle talk
events.description:
We will watch Dan Lew's talk on using Groovy & Gradle in your Android projects. After the video, we'll talk about what we learned.

Groovy!

events.name: u2020 Overview
events.description: Alex Wegener and Vince Kennedy will be going over u2020. This app showcases a variety of Square libraries including Dagger, Retrofit 2.0, ButterKnife, Scalpel and more.

events.name: Android Design Support Library
events.description: Tiffany Trusty will be presenting about bringing material to all Android devices, even pre 5.0 devices.

events.name: Android Winter Ball
events.description: Topic TBD

events.name: Kotlin Code Lab
events.description:
Bring your laptops and explore the brave new world of Kotlin. There'll be a brief introduction to Kotlin and then we'll work through a couple of Kotlin Code Koans as a group before breaking out to continue in small groups or pairs.

To get the most from this event, read up on Kotlin and it's syntax here - https://kotlinlang.org/docs/reference/

The Koans we'll be working through are here - https://kotlinlang.org/docs/tutorials/koans.html

It'd be best to have your computer set up before this meetup so we can jump right in and learn together.

events.name: API Testing for Android
events.description:
We'll be discussing a previous presented topic from Matt Swanson, reliable API Testing in Android with Mockito and Retrofit. Relevant blog post from Matt :

http://mdswanson.com/blog/2013/12/16/reliable-android-http-testing-with-retrofit-and-mockito.html

And the github repo https://github.com/swanson/retrofit-demo - Note that this repo is currently for Eclipse. I'll try to push an update for Android Studio for experimentation.

We'll have discussions on what's being tested and how, as well as what other items could be tested and how if new features were to be added.

We're also doing a call for organizers so if you'd be interested in leading GDG, please reach out and let us know.

events.name: The Three Things to Help get Your First Android Developer Job or Your Next Job
events.description: John Sonmez in his book Soft Skills: The software developer's life manualand Josh Kempin his book No Degree, No Problemhave three things they say you need to do to get your first developer's job or to get a new job that you want.   We will discuss those  and at the end of discussion we will have a 10 minute hands on workshop for recording and placing  animated GIFs in your GitHub repository, a technique that is used by Codepath in there San Francisco Android Development Classto help graduates enhance their portfolio.

events.name: Getting Started with Ionic 2, A Hybrid App Framework Based on Google's Anglular
events.description:
This will be an introduction to Ionic 2. We will discuss the differences between the original Ionic and the new release. We will also cover some of the differences between Ionic 2 and the other two major hybrid frameworks, Xamarin and React 2.

We can start creating the development environment and go over some free tutorials as well the best of the paid courses and books on the subject.  

There will also be a review of Ionic View is a free app on Android and IOS that allows you to distribute your app for testing without going through the App Store or Google Play Store for quick testing and prototyping.
events.how_to_find_us: Enter through the doors on the west side.

events.name: Bug Bounty Hunting
events.description:
Become a better developer, earn money, and make the internet a safer place! Learn about bug bounty hunting. This can be a hobby or a vocation. Google’s program pays between $100 and $20,000 per bug you find and this is just one of hundreds of bug bounty programs out there. You don’t have to be a code ninja, creativity and imagination play a larger role than algorithms and data structures. Get an overview of the bug bounty programs, learn the steps to get started, and how to build your own virtual lab for web or mobile (Android & IOS). We will introduce Google’s Gruyere, a free online course and environment to get you started in bug hunting. 

Beginners welcome. Food will be provided.

events.name: Panel Discussion on Developing for Android and IOS
events.description:
Can you develop for both Android and IOS ? What are the benefits and what are the pitfalls? What is the best way to learn both?

Looking at jobs in Indeed.com over 60% of the Android jobs mention IOS in both Indiana and the whole United States. 

Here is one person's view https://en.yeeply.com/blog/ios-android-app-developer-mastering-os/ , but I have also seen other views, it will be an interesting discussion!

events.name: Introductory Meetup (Re-initialization)
events.description:
Hello everyone! This meetup is a free, re-introductory meetup. The group has been stagnant for a while but I wish to revive it. We will talk about future meetups, involvement with Google and the Google Developer Community, possible topics, timings and venue possibilities, and possible guest speakers, all while drinking some coffee!

We hope to see you there!
events.how_to_find_us: There is free parking there so that shouldn't be a problem.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam - Overview & Setup
events.description:
Hello everyone! This our first technical meetup in quite some time. We will be talking about Google's new Flutter technology and will have a workshop helping people get set up with Flutter on their machines and possibly get a simple app going! There will be pizza and zWorks will also offer additional drinks and snacks.

"Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source."

More information here: https://flutter.io/

Requirements/Suggestions:
- Make sure to bring a Mac or a Windows laptop, either will work fine for the workshop portion of the event.
- Attendees should try to play around with the first few steps of the setup themselves beforehand since there are a lot of steps involved, but this is not a must.
- Having an Android emulator pre-installed will save a lot of time in setting up the Flutter environment.

This meetup will be loosely based on the first few parts of the Udacity course by the Google Flutter Development team found here: https://www.udacity.com/course/build-native-mobile-apps-with-flutter--ud905

UPDATE for workshop:
For the demo(s), we will be using Visual Studio Code on a Windows computer and will be running the app on an Android Emulator. Alternatively, attendees can follow the instructions on the website to set up their environment using other technologies like Mac, Linux, iOS, Android Studio, XCode, etc.

Plan:
6:30pm to 6:45pm: Networking/Food
6:45pm to 7:00pm: Flutter Overview
7:00pm to 8:00pm: Flutter Workshops

We hope to see you there!

UPDATE:
Doors are locked by default, if you arrive after 6:45p, contact us by commenting on this event's meetup page so we can let you in!
events.how_to_find_us: Free parking all around! UPDATE: Doors are locked by default, if you arrive after 6:45p, contact us by commenting on this event's meetup page so we can let you in!

events.name: How Can You Get Started with Machine Learning?
events.description:
Hello everyone!

Curious about machine learning? Come to this event and learn how to get started! Together we will explore the "ready to use" Machine Learning APIs provided by Google Cloud Platform. Then we will take a high level look at TensorFlow, the most popular open source machine learning library on Github.

No previous experience is required to attend. Don't forget a laptop and charger if you want to explore the APIs or TensorFlow on your own.

Pizza will be provided!
events.how_to_find_us: Free parking all around! Doors are locked by default. If you arrive after 6:45pm, contact us by commenting on this event's meetup page so we can let you in!

events.name: Study Jam | Networking in the Google Cloud
events.description:
Hello everyone!

Join our exploration of the Google Cloud with Google's Next Extended Qwiklabs! Firstly, we'll give you a quick overview of the GCP. Then for our first session, we will be looking into VPC networking fundamentals. Our second session will involve creating multiple VPC networks and some testing (given we have time). This will be a group excersise, and networking opportunities will be plenty, along with pizza!

No previous experience is required to attend. Don't forget a laptop and charger. We will be accessing this website for our Qwiklab:
https://sites.google.com/qwiklabs.com/cloudheronext19/qwiklabs/next-19-extended

Pizza will be provided!
events.how_to_find_us: Free parking all around! Doors are locked by default. If you arrive after 6:45pm, contact us by commenting on this event's meetup page so we can let you in!

events.name: Share Your Google Projects
events.description:
Hi Everyone, welcome to the re-launched Indy GDG! We're pleased to get the group back up and running with quarterly meetups.

At this event we would like 6-7 people to share their experience developing with Google tools and platforms: Firebase, Maps, Google Cloud, Angular, GSuite, etc. Please tell us what you've built this year!

While you're welcome to share on-the-spot, for planning purposes we would appreciate it if you would email the organizers or add a comment to this event if you're able to talk about your project.

During the meeting we will also ask you for feedback on topics for future events.

LUNCH PROVIDED - taco bar by nameless catering, courtesy of Lucid Services Group.
events.how_to_find_us:
Lucid Services Group is street level, with an entrance door on Capital Ave in between 11th & 10th street.  There is a hanging sign, as well as door signage on our Suite.

There is metered street parking available on Capital, 11th Street and Senate.

events.name: [ONLINE] Getting Unstuck: Strategies For Solving Problems
events.description:
Join us for our very first online meetup!! We'll have time for a meet & greet before the talk as well as Q&A with the speaker at the end.

Join our online event at: https://meet.google.com/mjg-sepn-zja

Getting Unstuck: Strategies For Solving Problems, by Steven Hicks:

"You’ve followed along with the docs. Everything seems like it should be working. You’ve looked over this code 20 times, but you can’t figure out why it’s failing. You’re frustrated, and you’re ready to give up.

Even with the simplest of problems, we can get stuck. It happens to engineers of all experience levels - new hires and senior engineers alike. The key to success as a developer is knowing how to get yourself unstuck.

In this session, we’ll start by reframing the act of getting stuck as a positive. Then we’ll talk about many strategies for identifying the problem and moving on. We’ll discuss the psychology behind these strategies, and answer questions like “Why do my best ideas come to me in the shower?” Finally, we’ll look at ways to harden yourself for the next time you get stuck.

Getting unstuck is a skill. This session will help you sharpen that skill, and prepare you for the next time you want to throw your keyboard out a window."

This online meetup hosted on Google Hangouts by Andromeda. https://www.andromeda16.com/

- - - - -
SPEAKER BIO

Steven Hicks is a web development generalist with nearly 20 years experience. He believes that code is for humans, and should be written with them in mind. Steve likes to use the right tool for the job, especially if the right tool is JavaScript. He strongly believes that if you ain't falling, you ain't learning.

Steve embraces continuous improvement and believes that a developer's job is to solve problems, not just write code. He is a speaker, a writer, a teacher, a learner, and a teammate.

When he isn't talking to the duck or crushing 1s and 0s, you can find Steve outside. He's probably camping with his family, racing a triathlon, running trails, or climbing fake rocks.

https://www.stevenhicks.me/

events.name: [ONLINE] JSON Data Modeling in Document Databases
events.description:
Meet us online for a talk by Matthew Groves about Data Modeling for Document Databases. We'll have time for a meet & greet before the talk as well as Q&A with the speaker at the end.

Join our online event at: https://meet.google.com/mkv-fbms-rin

"If you’re thinking about using a document database, it can be intimidating to start. A flexible data model gives you a lot of choices, but which way is the right way? Is a document database even the right tool?

In this session we’ll go over the basics of data modeling using JSON. We’ll compare and contrast with traditional RDBMS modeling. Impact on application code will be discussed, as well as some tooling that could be helpful along the way. The examples use the free, open-source Couchbase Server document database, but the principles from this session can also be applied to CosmosDb, Mongo, RavenDb, etc."

This online meetup hosted on Google Hangouts by Andromeda. https://www.andromeda16.com/

- - - - -
SPEAKER BIO

Matthew D. Groves is a guy who loves to code. It doesn't matter if it's C#, jQuery, or PHP: he'll submit pull requests for anything. He has been coding professionally ever since he wrote a QuickBASIC point-of-sale app for his parent's pizza shop back in the 90s. He currently works as a Developer Advocate for Couchbase. His free time is spent with his family, watching the Reds, and getting involved in the developer community. He is the author of AOP in .NET (published by Manning), and is also a Microsoft MVP.

https://crosscuttingconcerns.com/

upcoming.name: [ONLINE] Serverless: Knative on GCP, Cloud Run and why you should care
upcoming.description:
Meet us online for a talk by Google engineer Abdel about Knative and Cloud Run. We'll have time for a meet & greet before the talk as well as Q&A with the speaker at the end.

Join our online event at: https://meet.google.com/myu-kfvw-ydj

"So Knative, Cloud Run and all of that Serverless goodness, but what is it, why people are building it and why we have offering around it. In this talk i will explain the history (everyones favorite topic), motivation and the how behind Knative and Cloud Run. Join me and we will take a docker app from the internet and make it Run on Cloud Run."

This online meetup hosted on Google Hangouts by Andromeda. https://www.andromeda16.com/

- - - - -
SPEAKER BIO

Abdelfettah SGHIOUAR is a
Google Cloud Engineer with a focus on Serveless, Kubernetes, and Devops Methodologies. A big fan and supporter of OSS software and evangelising for Kubernetes

https://twitter.com/boredabdel

upcoming.name: [ONLINE] Introduction to Elasticsearch
upcoming.description:
Log on to our May meetup to learn more about Elasticsearch! Chris Knuteson will introduce Elasticsearch, and explain the complexities of full-text searching. He will show you how to get started and how to integrate your solution into Google Cloud.

Our thanks to Elasticsearch for hosting this online event.

upcoming.name: [ONLINE] PWA is the future!
upcoming.description:
Meet us online for a talk by Udhay about Progressive Web Apps in Angular. We'll have time for a meet & greet before the talk as well as Q&A with the speaker at the end.

Join our online event at: https://meet.google.com/bhf-meie-tto

"More than just a buzzword in past couple years, Progressive Web App (PWA) is a set of guidelines to make use of modern browser features in a way that creates a more app-like user experience than traditional mobile web app. In this talk, I will discuss on concepts, steps involved in PWA development, and best practices with quick demo of an app developed using Angular."

This online meetup hosted on Google Hangouts by Andromeda. https://www.andromeda16.com/

- - - - -
SPEAKER BIO

Udhay is the Organizer of RTP, Raleigh and Online Angular meetups, a Blogger at AngularHive, and a Consultant.

https://angularhive.com/
https://www.meetup.com/RTP-Angular/

upcoming.name: [ONLINE] I Feel the Need For Web Page Speed
upcoming.description:
Meet us online for a talk by Bill Dinger about website performance. We'll have time for a meet & greet before the talk as well as Q&A with the speaker at the end.

Join our online event at: https://meet.google.com/dpi-kmzk-fbr

"We demand high performance web applications. To build them we need every single piece of information to help us find actionable ways of speeding up our applications. In this session learn how to use the performance API together with common browser performance tooling to determine down to the method level how long our pages take to perform operations. We’ll also touch briefly on instrumenting up popular frameworks such as React & Angular, running performance checks on mobile browsers, and free open source tools that can help you diagnose and monitor performance."

This online meetup hosted on Google Hangouts by Andromeda. https://www.andromeda16.com/

- - - - -
SPEAKER BIO

Bill Dinger is a Senior Technical Lead at Ameritas working on delivering digital solutions to our clients. Over the last 15 years Bill has worked in enterprise IT starting in the trenches on the help desk. After that, Bill spent almost a decade working in infrastructure support focusing in the Microsoft stack. Over the last 5 years Bill has been developing, architecting and leading teams of software developers. During that time Bill has done everything from troubleshoot dial up connections in rural Nebraska to building the digital experiences for some of America's most well known brands.

When not working, Bill will probably be found on his bike exploring gravel roads in his hometown of Lincoln, Nebraska.

https://www.linkedin.com/in/bill-dinger-45baa1b1/

upcoming.name: [ONLINE] TDD is my Shame
upcoming.description:
Meet us online for a talk by Gary Fleming about Test Driven Development. We'll have time for a meet & greet before the talk as well as Q&A with the speaker at the end.

Join our online event at: https://meet.google.com/fub-nqqp-xxe

About the Talk:

"I don't do as much Test-Driven Development as I should; it's my shame."

The more time I spend at recent development conferences, the more I see this sentiment echoed. Developers get the impression that they should do TDD, but they don't.

Sometimes they don't know how to do it effectively, so it ends up a mess. Sometimes they don't know when they should do it, so it ends up being overapplied. Sometimes they don't really know what it is, so they end up treating it in odd ways.

In this talk, you'll get answers for all of the above and more. You'll understand TDD better, you'll understand how to be more effective, and you'll learn to let go of that little voice that says you should do more.

This online meetup hosted on Google Hangouts by Andromeda. https://www.andromeda16.com/

- - - - -
SPEAKER BIO

Gary Fleming is an agile coach, software crafter, and systems thinker. His main hobby is to try and help companies to build better software in better ways. Sometimes this is by helping them with the messy human communication side of agile, sometimes its helping them reflect on their processes, and sometimes it's through teaching better software crafting practices - usually some of each. Coaching, mentoring, teaching, and showing; whatever helps in the context. You'll find him at various local meetups and international conferences trying to both share what he knows and learn from his peers.

https://twitter.com/garyfleming
https://github.com/garyfleming

organizers.name: Michael D.
organizers.bio: Michael is a 2019 Google Developer Expert in Firebase, an entrepreneur, author, and international speaker. He combines his years of software development expertise with his business process knowledge to deliver software-based business solutions.

group_profile.intro: Greetings, I am a Google Developer Expert in Firebase and interested in connecting with other local Google Developers!
Indy area software engineer with a passion for mobile dev.
